meanings.definition: To float easily and gently on the air
meanings.sent1: The feather was wafting down from the sky.
meanings.sent2: The aroma of freshly baked cookies wafting from the kitchen made everyone hungry.
meanings.sent3: The balloon wafted lazily through the room, causing giggles from the children.
meanings.sent4: Her voice wafted through the auditorium, captivating the audience.
meanings.sent5: The music wafted softly through the park, creating a peaceful atmosphere.

meanings.sent1: The wafting breeze brought relief on a hot summer day.
meanings.sent2: I felt the wafting of the wind as I stood by the open window.
meanings.sent3: The wafting of the curtains made the room feel cozy and inviting.
meanings.sent4: The wafting of the leaves in the trees signaled the arrival of autumn.
meanings.sent5: The wafting of the fan provided a cool breeze in the stuffy room.

meanings.definition: A scent carried through the air
meanings.sent1: The wafting of flowers filled the garden with a sweet fragrance.
meanings.sent2: I followed the wafting of freshly brewed coffee to the kitchen.
meanings.sent3: The wafting of perfume from the passerby caught my attention.
meanings.sent4: The wafting of barbecue smoke made my mouth water.
meanings.sent5: The wafting of sea salt in the air reminded me of the beach.
